de.fhluebeck.group3.DAO

Class RecipeDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fhluebeck.group3.DAO.RecipeDAO

  • public final class RecipeDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    RecipeDAO is major responsible for Data Access in Recipe table, functions like addRecipe, getRecipeByName, updateRecipe are provided.
    Author:
    Shan Jiaxiang on 2018/5/27.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      RecipeDAO() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean addRecipe(Recipe recipe)
      Add the recipe to the DB, here we do have to do "batch-insertion" which means while insert the basic information of recipe, we call the function from ingredientDAO and stepDAO to insert corresponding ingredients and steps.
      static boolean addRecipeToFavoriteList(java.lang.Integer recipeId, java.lang.Integer userId)
      Add an recipe to favorite of a specified user.
      static boolean deleteRecipe(java.lang.Integer recipeID)
      Delete the recipe according to its ID, here we do not have to delete ingredients and steps owned by the recipe.

      Get the Favorite Recipe By its name.

      This method is called after a new recipe is inserted into the DB to retrive the ID of the recipe;

      Search for the recipes with the ingredient, which is regular expression.

      Remove an specific recipe from favorite of a specified user.
      static boolean updateRecipe(Recipe recipe)

      • getRecipesByUser

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getRecipesByUser(User user)
        Search for the recipes that owned by specific user.
        Parameters:
        user: - the current user that owns the recipes
        Returns:
        recipes: a list of recipes owned by the user.

      • getRecipeID

        public static java.lang.Integer getRecipeID(Recipe recipe)
        This method is called after a new recipe is inserted into the DB to retrive the ID of the recipe;
        Parameters:
        recipe - specific recipe.
        Returns:
        the ID of the recipe.

        Remove an specific recipe from favorite of a specified user.
        Parameters:

        recipeId - the ID of the recipe.

        whether the procedure is successful.

      • getAllRecipes

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getAllRecipes()
        Search for all recipes.
        Returns:
        recipes: a list of recipes.

      • getRecipesByName

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getRecipesByName(java.lang.String recipeName)
        Search for the recipes that match the recipeName, which is regular expression.
        Parameters:
        recipeName: - the recipe name used to search for satisfied recipes.
        Returns:
        recipes: a list of recipes that satisfied the regular expression "*recipeName*"

      • getRecipesByIngredient

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getRecipesByIngredient(java.lang.String ingredientName)
        Search for the recipes with the ingredient, which is regular expression.
        Parameters:
        ingredientName: - the ingredient name used to search for satisfied recipes.
        Returns:
        recipes: a list of recipes that satisfied the regular expression "*recipeName*"

      • getRecipesByIds

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getRecipesByIds(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> recipeIds)
        Search for the recipes with the recipe IDs, which is a list. This method involves with batch search, which I get the reference from:https://blog.csdn.net/suifeng3051/article/details/24033237
        Parameters:
        recipeIds: - list of recipe IDs provided by the user.
        Returns:
        recipes: a list of recipes that with the IDs.

      • deleteRecipe

        public static boolean deleteRecipe(java.lang.Integer recipeID)
        Delete the recipe according to its ID, here we do not have to delete ingredients and steps owned by the recipe.
        Parameters:
        recipeID: - recipe ID which the user wants to delete from DB.
        Returns:
        flag: whether the function is succeeded or not.

      • updateRecipe

        public static boolean updateRecipe(Recipe recipe)
        Update the recipe according to its ID, here we do have to do "batch-update" which means while update the information of recipe, we call the function from ingredientDAO and stepDAO to update corresponding ingredients and steps.
        Parameters:
        recipe: - new version of recipe which we want to update in the DB.
        Returns:
        flag: whether the function is succeeded or not.

      • addRecipe

        public static boolean addRecipe(Recipe recipe)
        Add the recipe to the DB, here we do have to do "batch-insertion" which means while insert the basic information of recipe, we call the function from ingredientDAO and stepDAO to insert corresponding ingredients and steps.
        Parameters:
        recipe: - new version of recipe which we want to insert into the DB.
        Returns:
        flag: whether the function is succeeded or not.

      • getFavoritedRecipes

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getFavoritedRecipes(java.lang.Integer userid)
        Search for the recipes which the current user likes.
        Parameters:
        userid: - specific user.
        Returns:
        recipes: a list of recipes that the user favorites.

      • getFavRecipeByIngredients

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getFavRecipeByIngredients(java.lang.String ingredientName,
                                                               java.lang.Integer userId)
        Get the Favorite Recipe By its ingredients.
        Parameters:
        ingredientName - the name of the ingredient.
        userId - the ID of the current user.
        Returns:
        The list of recipes that meet the requirements.

      • getFavRecipeByName

        public static java.util.List<Recipe> getFavRecipeByName(java.lang.String recipeName,
                                                        java.lang.Integer userId)
        Get the Favorite Recipe By its name.
        Parameters:
        recipeName - the name of the recipe.
        userId - the ID of the current user.
        Returns:
        The list of recipes that meet the requirements.
